results.title: The Anti-hero [study extract]
results.brief_description: Excerpt from British film “The Loneliness of the Long Distance Runner” in which six young men are incarcerated in a correctional institution for male offenders called Ruxton Towers. The prisoners are encouraged to conform, with emphasis placed on discipline and team work through sports. One lad who is groomed by the Governor for possible olympic stardom ends up showing his contempt for authority by sabotaguing Ruxton Towers chance at victory in an inter-prison cross country competition.

results.title: The Ant and the dove
results.creator_credit: Coronet Instructional Films and Gakken Company
results.brief_description: One good turn deserves another is the moral of this fable by Aesop. This charming tale of an ant who, despite his small size, is able to save the life of his friend, the dove, will stimulate and delight young children.

results.title: The Amish: a people of preservation (Edited version)
results.brief_description: Four and a half centuries ago, a group of Swiss Christians formed a community dedicated to applying the teachings of Jesus to every aspect of their daily life. In 1693, this group split into a conservative group (the Amish) and a more liberal group (the Mennonites). The Amish were persecuted as dangerous Utopian heretics in their homeland, and many fled to America. Over 75,000 Amish still live in farming communities in America, practising the same lifestyle of Amish in centuries past, living a life devoted to humility, duty, kindliness and order. This documentary discusses various aspects of the Amish community, including history, their world view, and the simplicity of their lifestyle. Shows various family activities.

results.title: The American revolution
results.creator_credit: Carol Greenwald, Metropolitan Museum of Art and WGBH Educational Foundation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Western tradition”.
This absorbing series is a survey of 2,000 years of Western civilisation illustrated by paintings, sculpture and other records from the past, compiled by the Metropolitan Museum of Art. Historian Eugen Weber looks at the American revolution and how British colonists created a society that tested Enlightenment ideas and resisted restrictions imposed by England.

results.title: The American republic
results.creator_credit: Art Cohen, Metropolitan Museum of Art and WGBH Educational Foundation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Western tradition”.
This absorbing series is a survey of 2,000 years of Western civilisation illustrated by paintings, sculpture and other records from the past, compiled by the Metropolitan Museum of Art. Historian Eugen Weber analyses the American Republic which was comprised of radicals and conservatives and founded on the premises of “Universal Freedoms” for its inhabitants.

results.title: The Amazon: life along the river in Peru
results.brief_description: Following the Amazon River to its sources in the High Andes of Peru, this film surveys the geography of the Maranon river area and the peoples way of life and variation in climate and vegetation on the western and eastern slopes and in the foothills of the Andes. Also shown is the city of Iquitos - the trade centre of the Upper Andes and its environs, the abundantly productive rainforests No other credits available.

results.title: The Amazing laser
results.creator_credit: Eddie Newstead, Richard Reisz and London Television Service
results.brief_description: The laser has applications in many fields, from entertainment to scientific research. Looks at some of the ways in which lasers are being used, and possible future development with lasers. It is being used in the printing industry for etching copper plates, in the search for cheap energy by producing fusion reactions in the laboratory, as a scalpel in surgery, and for making holograms. Narrated by Paul Vaughan.

results.title: The Alternatives to Infertility
results.brief_description: In this program, the various methods of treatment that are available to infertile couples are listed. The aim of the program is to teach both patients and the community at large about current reproductive technology. The issues of ethics, morality and legality are not discussed.

results.title: The Allport collection
results.brief_description: The Allport Collection is a unique assembly of the art of early Tasmania and various objects of the 19th Century, housed in the State Library of Tasmania. In this documentary the curator of the collection gives some insight into its purpose and historical importance. No other credits available.
